In appointing Andy Coulson , David Cameron judged his experience and skills outweighed the political risk that the phone-tapping scandal might resurface. The cloud of allegations surrounding Andy Coulson 's tenure at the News of the World raised real questions about his ability to be at the heart of the Downing Street machine. He's now done the right thing but he should have done it earlier, Labour leader Ed Miliband told reporters.`` I think it raises real questions about David Cameron 's judgment that he hung on to Andy Coulson for so long.''
